contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox organization |name = Zonta International |image = |image_border = |size = 250px |caption = Zonta International emblem |formation = 1919 |type = [[Service club]] |headquarters =Oakwod Chicago |location = Global |motto = ''Advancing the Status of Women Worldwide'' |membership = 31,000 |language = |leader_title = |leader_name = |key_people = [[Amelia Earhart]] (member) |num_staff = |budget = |website = [http://www.zonta.org/ www.zonta.org/] }} '''Zonta International''' is an international [[Fraternal and service organizations|service organization]] with the mission of advancing the status of women.<ref>[[Alan Axelrod]] ''International Encyclopedia of Secret Societies and Fraternal Orders'' New York; Facts on File, inc 1997 p.271</ref> The first Zonta Club was founded in [[Buffalo, New York]] in 1919 and the '''Confederation of Zonta Clubs''' was formed in 1930. Originally conceived as a female equivalent of the [[Lions Clubs ]], Zonta sponsors program to help women in the field of public affairs and policy making. It has [[consultative status]] with the [[Council of Europe]], the UN, ILO, and several UN agencies.<ref>Axelrod p.271</ref> Currently, Zonta International is headquartered in [[Oak Brook, Illinois]]. The organization has more than 31,000 members in 65 countries. Zonta is well known for its Amelia Earhart Fellowship program, founded in 1938 in honor of [[Amelia Earhart]], who was a member of Zonta. The Fellowship provides funds for women to study aerospace science or [[engineering]] at the graduate level.<ref>[http://www.zonta.org/WhoWeAre/ZIHistory.aspx ZI History]</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.zonta.org/ Zonta International Web Page] * A [http://www.lib.utexas.edu/taro/utsa/00032/utsa-00032.html finding aid] for a collection of Zonta related papers at the [[University of Texas at San Antonio]] [[Category:Organizations established in 1919]] [[Category:Women's organizations in the United States]] [[Category:Women in business]] [[Category:Fraternal service organizations]] {{org-stub}}
